meanings.definition: To attempt to influence or pressure (someone) by talking persuasively or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She jawboned her friend into going to the party with her.
meanings.sent2: The manager jawboned the team into working overtime to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jawboned the students into studying for the test with promises of a fun review game.
meanings.sent4: The politician jawboned the voters with promises of positive change.
meanings.sent5: The coach jawboned the players into giving their best performance on the field.

meanings.definition: To engage in persuasive or forceful talk or discussion.
meanings.sent1: He always jawboned during meetings to make sure his ideas were heard.
meanings.sent2: The group jawboned for hours to come to a decision on the project.
meanings.sent3: The siblings jawboned over who would get the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: The friends jawboned about their favorite movies late into the night.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors jawboned about the noisy construction next door.
